intro: Pityrodia cuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed panicled everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form. The plant produces small, clustered white or pink flowers that bloom in spring, followed by fluffy, seed-bearing structures. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, often covered in a fine layer of white powder. Pityrodia cuneata is well adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions of southern Australia.
